intro: Conohoria dentata, commonly known as the toothed conohoria, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with distinct toothed margins and showy, pale pink to white flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, forested areas. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
